Paydiant Mobile Payment Android SDK API v.7.1.0.2.a

This documents is the API specification for the Android version of the Paydiant Mobile Payment SDK.

See: Description

This documents is the API specification for the Android version of the Paydiant Mobile Payment SDK.

Overview

This document provides the API specifications to develop secure mobile payment applications for Android platform using the Paydiant Mobile Payment SDK.

SDK structure

Paydiant's mobile payment SDK for the Android operating system is constructed to provide optimum flexibility and simplified programming, while also maximizing performance, functional depth and security for both the underlying platform and the reference application itself.

Each functional module of the SDK is exposed in two option packages:

  • UI Services

    Paydiant's pre-defined implementation for the Android and contains the underlying Android services and callback mechanisms to streamline development of the reference application.

    The UI package utilizes the specific Android service protocols for thread management and callback mechanisms. This package provides a bridge between the pure Java methods of the SDK and the Android reference application to streamline development.

    The UI package consists of the primary Service package, which is divided into several sub-packages consistent with each functional module within the SDK. See com.paydiant.android.ui.service packages for more information.

  • Core Services

    A strict Java API that does not include any Android-specific classes and is ideal for developers who wish to exhibit more control over the implementation of the SDK.

    This is a simple Java API that exposes the functionality of the SDK for developers who choose to have a finer level of control over the application's consumption of each class.

    The classes of the Core package are divided among several functional package layers. See com.paydiant.android.core.facade for more information..

SDK Configuration

SDK needs to be configured and initialized in order to perform mobile gateway related operations. This is done through PaydiantApplicationConfig.setupPaydiantApplicationConfig() method.

Sample Configuration:


public static final String HOST_IP = "<hostname>";
public static final String HOST_URL = HOST_IP + "<URL Suffix>";
public static final String PROTOCOL = "<protocol>";
private ContextWrapper androidContextInstance;
private byte[] appSignature = new byte[]{<app_signature_as_bytes>};

PaydiantApplicationConfig.getPaydiantApplicationConfig().setupPaydiantApplicationConfig(HOST_URL, PROTOCOL, androidContextInstance, appSignature);

SDK Logging Configuration

From SDK v.4.6.0.1, SDK supports logging successful/failed SDK events internally. To enable this feature, one of the following must be done before using any of the functionalities provided by the Core Services or UI Services.

  1. The PaydiantLoggingUtility class must be initialized through PaydiantLoggingUtility.init(ContextWrapper, int, boolean) method or
  2. Custom ISDKLoggingUtility set through SDKLoggingHelper.setSDKLoggingUtility(ISDKLoggingUtility) method

Sample Configuration:


PaydiantLoggingUtility.init(<Android_ContextWrapper_Instance>, 100, true);

Note:To use PaydiantLoggingUtility class, the PaydiantLoggingService needed to be configured as a service in the AndriodManifest.xml


<service android:name="com.paydiant.android.ui.service.logging.PaydiantLoggingService" />
